descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding of transformations.
Student can identify transformations of f(x) + k or f(x + k) but struggles with kf(x) or f(kx).
Student can identify transformations of f(x) + k, kf(x), f(kx), and f(x + k) for positive values of k.
Student can identify transformations of f(x) + k, kf(x), f(kx), and f(x + k) for both positive and negative values of k but struggles with fractional values.
Student can accurately identify transformations of f(x) + k, kf(x), f(kx), and f(x + k) for both positive, negative, and fractional values of k.
Student can accurately identify transformations and explain the effects on the graph of f(x) + k, kf(x), f(kx), and f(x + k) for all values of k, and can find the value of k given the graphs.
Student cannot differentiate between even and odd functions.
Student can differentiate between even and odd functions given their graphs, but not from algebraic expressions.
Student can differentiate between even and odd functions given algebraic expressions, but not from their graphs.
Student can differentiate between even and odd functions from both their graphs and algebraic expressions with some errors.
Student can accurately differentiate between even and odd functions from both their graphs and algebraic expressions.
Student can accurately differentiate between even and odd functions from both their graphs and algebraic expressions and explain their properties.
Student does not use technology to experiment with transformations.
Student uses technology to experiment with transformations but struggles to explain the effects on the graph.
Student can use technology to experiment with transformations and explain the effects on the graph for simple cases.
Student can use technology to experiment with transformations and explain the effects on the graph for most cases with minor errors.
Student can effectively use technology to experiment with transformations and accurately explain the effects on the graph.
Student can effectively use technology to experiment with transformations, accurately explain the effects on the graph, and provide a clear and concise explanation supported by examples.
